main event: A bright, rainbow-colored object was observed moving erratically in the sky over Monbridge, South Carolina, on October 6, 1954.
interesting points: The object was described as being about 6-10 feet in diameter and triangular shaped, The sighting lasted for 3-4 minutes with erratic zig-zag motion, Observers reported the object initially heading from E/SE and changing speeds between 120-600 knots, There were 5 confirmed witnesses to the sighting, Military officers found the object probable to be a meteor despite the lack of a trailing tail.
witness description: Military personnel and civilians from Raleigh, N.C. and Florence, S.C.
